page.title: 15Oakleigh Farm
page.content: Oakleigh farm and Oakleigh lodge are surrounded by good farming land. The land is well drained and leads into a big pond behind the farm house. The farm has a big barn shelter with much machinery.The farm itself grows mostly cereal crops with a few vegetables and strawberries.Rough grazing land is also there for livestock. Cereals that are grown are principally wheat and barley, the vegetables growing were cabbages, leeks and potatoes.On the grazing land were horses and cattle.Some work is provided by the farm by picking the crops.A disused railway runs through the farm giving it an embankment separating the rough grazing area from the remaining land.A new feature of the landscape is a reservoir probably built as an aid to farming.
